column5: I have a canoe trip on G Bay planned for July so this is great news for me.  http://www.goderichsignalstar.com/2016/04/06/hurongeorgian-bay-at-1998-levels-and-rising
GBay has been up the past few years.  Nice trend.

It,s a canoe, how much water do you need? LOL  Simcoe levels are up already. Much sooner then any other time. Wheres all this water coming from? Have we shut down the water flow going into the states? Or is it the other way around?

It,s a canoe, how much water do you need? LOL    When the water is high you can go into all sorts inlets and coves that you can't in high water, into more sheltered areas, and stay out of the motorboat areas.

When the water is high you can go into all sorts inlets and coves that you can't in high water, into more sheltered areas, and stay out of the motorboat areas.  Ah, I see.  Im working on a toon drift weekend on the geen this summer. I have been told and read, the smallie fishing is awesome.
